title: Senior Specialist Education Professional
content:
At NICE, we don’t limit our challenges. We challenge our limits. Constantly. We’re relentless. We’re ambitious. And we make an impact. Our NICErs bring their A game and spend each day turning it into an A+. And if you’re like us, we can offer you the kind of challenge that will light a fire within you.  Responsibilities:  -

Deliver high-quality WFM & EEM training to customers and business partners
Training delivery primarily in virtual classrooms over multiple time zones, occasionally delivering training on site
Focus on the business value that the customer and partners gain from the products and solutions, as well as the technical aspect of installation configuring, and usage of the solution
Deliver services according to customer business processes and requirements
Work closely with the project team to ensure delivery that is consistent with commitments and expectations
Learn new products, features, and tools as they are rolled out by the organization
Apply effective techniques and methods to create an environment in which learning can succeed
Follow administrative procedures as required, including preparations and wrap up
Develop training content in various formats

  Requirements:  

Excellent Communication Skills  (written and verbal) – English
Relevant Bachelors's or Masters's degree in Technology
Minimum 3 years of experience as a Product Trainer or a Corporate Trainer in a technology company preferably SaaS/CPaaS/UCaaS from CX platform – an advantage
Domain experience with contact center and Workforce Management solutions. 
Knowledge of NICE WFM solutions Experience in NICE WFM or similar workforce management tools in contact center platforms like Avaya, Verint, Genesys, Five9, etc. – an advantage
Experience in working on Linux-based platforms, functional knowledge of Linux/Unix environment.
Excellent presentation and facilitation skills
Ability to quickly learn by shadowing training and self-learning
Self-motivated and strives for professional excellence in all aspects of work
Work cross-functionally and collaborate with different stakeholders like consultants, project managers, SMEs, and Training coordinators
Able to work flexibly and independently in a fluid environment
Able to work successfully with clients and business partners directly
Excellent problem-solving ability in high-pressure situations
Able to work in a global environment and deliver virtual courses in various time zones
Additional Foreign languages – an advantage
Has a passion for training, learning, and sharing knowledge

 About NICE 
NICE Ltd. (NASDAQ: NICE) software products are used by 25,000+ global businesses, including 85 of the Fortune 100 corporations, to deliver extraordinary customer experiences, fight financial crime and ensure public safety. Every day, NICE software manages more than 120 million customer interactions and monitors 3+ billion financial transactions. 
Known as an innovation powerhouse that excels in AI, cloud and digital, NICE is consistently recognized as the market leader in its domains, with over 8,500 employees across 30+ countries. 
NICE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, neurotype, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other category protected by law.
